summary: Multiplying and dividing integers follows a simple pattern. Two negatives make a positive, but one negative and one positive make a negative.

concepts.title: Rule 1: Negative × Negative = Positive
concepts.kid_friendly: If two people both say 'no', it turns into a 'yes'! Example: (-3) × (-2) = 6

concepts.title: Rule 2: Negative ÷ Negative = Positive
concepts.kid_friendly: Dividing two negatives also turns positive. Example: (-12) ÷ (-3) = 4

concepts.title: Rule 3: Negative × Positive = Negative
concepts.kid_friendly: If one number is negative and the other is positive, the result is negative. Example: (-4) × (5) = -20

concepts.title: Rule 4: Negative ÷ Positive = Negative
concepts.kid_friendly: A negative divided by a positive is still negative. Example: (-15) ÷ (3) = -5

concepts.title: Rule 5: Positive × Positive = Positive
concepts.kid_friendly: This is like normal multiplication. Example: (6) × (2) = 12

teaching_tips: Use real-world examples like money (debt = negative, savings = positive).
Remind kids: same signs = positive, different signs = negative.
Practice with flashcards showing sign rules.
